channel.title: Posts on A Megan website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on A Megan website

item.title: Simple-a hugo theme - small edits to personalize.
item.description: Hello again! New year, and I'm already getting into more complicated hugo/blogdown projects. Over the holidays I'd been blogging and encountered some (unfixable to me) issues with the first site I generated. After consultation with colleagues and many many hours on SO and various other websites, I decided to start over. Upon reading through the blogdown book again, I decided to try one of their simple recommended themes! I went with simple-a because it looked nice and was recommended by the blogdown folks.

item.title: Inequality Map
item.description: Income inequality and health research I wrote my Master’s thesis on the topic of income inequality and health in Canadian cities. To show inequality throughout Canada, I mapped inequality levels for each Canadian city for three time periods: 2001, 2006, and 2011. Here is a reproduction of that map, which now includes 2016. Map ## Warning: `as.tibble()` is deprecated, use `as_tibble()` (but mind the new semantics).

item.title: A very intro introduction to DPLYR, from RLadies MTL
item.description: Last month, on a break during my workday, I decided to google some communities where I could practice and learn to code in R. It had been on my mind for a while, as I’ve had many side project ideas and lack any coding skills to make them happen. ~R Ladies~ I came across R Ladies - a community of women (and other folks) in Montreal that meet once a month to learn something new in R!

item.title: New website!
item.description: I created a new website using Hugo! This will be a slow process to figure out, but I'm hoping to make it my long-term, sustained website where I can blog about learning code and share figures and stories related to my research. See ya soon, Megan

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday's Markdown and Pandoc's Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
